input_text:
Job Title: Analyst Product Owner

Location: Nashville, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Job Title
Analyst Product Owner

Job Description

Analyst Product Owner
Using your strong expertise in business analytics and delivery of reports and dashboards, your role will help answer business questions with data across the various business domains of your stakeholders, and act as the Product Owner for dashboards and reports that the technical delivery teams build and maintain for your portfolio of stakeholders in the North American Market.

Your role:
Using PowerBI, Excel and other analytic tools, respond to questions and deliver answers with data and solutions that meet the needs of the requestor.For stakeholders needing PowerBI or Salesforce CRMA dashboards, define the analytic product vision and requirements, develop and maintain the high-level product roadmap and act as the product’s ambassador through its lifecycle aligning the product features and capabilities to Stakeholder NeedsCollaborates with the Stakeholder Success Leader to perform discovery and requirements gathering activities with Stakeholders.Co-manages the Product Team through delivery sprints with the delivery team leaders for dashboards and reports.Works with the Product Team to prioritize and quickly resolve break/fixes.Ensure the quality, integrity, and reliability of analytic products and applications.Monitor analytic product adoption and ensure performance and efficiency.Stay up-to-date on the latest Azure technologies in business intelligence and automation.

You're the right fit if:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field4+ years delivering analytic solutions such as dashboards or reportsStrong knowledge of Azure services and SharepointExperience with data processing languages such as SQL, Python, and ScalaExperience with agile methodologies on Azure DevOps and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD)Experience in Healthcare or Medical Technology Sectors, preferredExperience with Azure AI services, preferredExperience with no-code/low-code platforms or automation platforms such as UI Path, preferredStrong problem-solving and analytical skillsExcellent communication and collaboration skillsYou must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this position. 

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in or within commuting distance to Nashville, TN.

About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.

Learn more about our business.Discover our rich and exciting history.Learn more about our purpose.

If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

This requisition is expected to stay active for 45 days but may close earlier if a successful candidate is selected or business necessity dictates. Interested candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible to ensure consideration.

Philips is an Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran and maintains a drug-free workplace.

Experience Level (if available): None

Define the analytic product vision and requirements for PowerBI or Salesforce CRMA dashboards.
Develop and maintain the high-level product roadmap and act as the product’s ambassador through its lifecycle.
Collaborate with the Stakeholder Success Leader to perform discovery and requirements gathering activities with Stakeholders.
Co-manage the Product Team through delivery sprints with the delivery team leaders for dashboards and reports.
Work with the Product Team to prioritize and quickly resolve break/fixes.
Ensure the quality, integrity, and reliability of analytic products and applications.
Monitor analytic product adoption and ensure performance and efficiency.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position.
